page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY OF SHALBOURNE
page.content: It has had many names in the past, but in the{Domesday Book}it was called {Scaldeburn.}The most likely derivation of the name is from its shallow brook which is still in existance. There are several houses of historical interest, some recently altered, but only three are graded 1 or 2:{The Grove}which was a Queen Anne farmhouse and{The Manor and its large barn. At{Bedwyn Brail}an excavation of a large{Roman villa, {mentioned in the}Domesday Books, has been taking place over past years, latterly by experts and students from {Ruttger's University, Indiana.}In the past it has been robbed (its stones contributed to Bedwyn church) but is now covered by tarpaulins and earth each winter and uncovered before work begins in Spring. All articles of interest are catalogued, cleaned and sent to{Devizes Museum.
